metadata.title: CVE-2019-2963 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.17 and prior. Easilyexploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with networkaccess via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successfulattacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause ahang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS3.0 Base Score 4.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-client - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-router - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-server - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.18-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.18-0ubuntu3').
